means: 价钱为，花费(cost的现在分词)
[计]= COST Accounting and Information System Guide,成本会计和信息系统指南

sentence.Network_en: Such complacency is costing the company dear.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种自满情绪正使公司付出沉重代价。

sentence.Network_en: Here is a detailed costing of our proposals.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是我们的方案的详细成本计算。

sentence.Network_en: All these stoppages are costing the company a fortune.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有这些罢工事件使公司损失了一大笔财富.

entry.def: A costing is an estimate of all the costs involved in a project or a business venture.

example.ex: We'll put together a proposal, including detailed costings, free of charge.
example.tran: 我们将免费拟一份提案，其中包括详细的成本估算。

auth_sentence.content: Smoking is an absolute curse, costing the taxpayer billions.
auth_sentence.res_content: Smoking is an absolute curse, costing the taxpayer billions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Smoking is an absolute curse, costing the taxpayer billions.

auth_sentence.content: Costing little; inexpensive: a frugal lunch.

auth_sentence.content: Not by any economic costing and benefiting.

Sentence.sentence: They're also expensive, especially when you factor in the average college student's limited budget, typically costing hundreds of dollars every semester.
Furthermore, students will be able to purchase sections of the text instead of buying the whole thing, with individual chapters costing as little as $200.
